titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Office of the President, Senior Advisor, Office Files of Frank DeGiovanni
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Office of the President, Senior Advisor, Office Files of Frank DeGiovanni FA1876

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-03-01 05:23:48 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Office of the President, Senior Advisor, Office Files of Frank DeGiovanni

physdesc.extent: 69 document boxes: 55 letter boxes and 14 legal boxes

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

This material was transferred to the RAC in eight accessions between 2020 and 2024 and was ingested by the RAC as Accessions 2020:013, 2020:036, 2021:141, 2022:031, 2022:057, 2023:024, 2023:075, and 2024:072.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is comprised of two series.
Original order was maintained as much as possible.
The collection arrangement is as follows:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the office files Frank DeGiovanni created and maintained when he worked at the Ford Foundation for over 20 years. The files primarily originate from DeGiovanni's positions as Director of the Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS) Economic Development unit, Director of the Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) Financial Assets unit, and Senior Advisor to the President. There is a smaller amount of material from DeGiovanni's time as a Program Officer and then Deputy Director of Program Related Investments (PRI).

The collection consists of two series. The first series contains notebooks Frank DeGiovanni created and used throughout various points in his career at the Foundation. DeGiovanni's subject files are contained in the second series and comprise the bulk of the collection.

Subject files regarding DeGiovanni's leadership of the Ford Foundation's programming for asset building and economic development provide insight into almost 20 years of activities and strategy for the Foundation's engagement in those fields. Grants, projects, and initiatives focused on:
- Financial asset building and economic security for lower income families, poverty reduction, access to financial services, savings accounts
- Development finance, equitable economic development, and pro-poor development
- Community development
- Microfinance
- Sustainable development, rural development, value chains, and food security
- Consumer protection and consumer credit
- Housing, homeownership, and mortgages
- Economic policy
- Program Related Investments (PRI) and impact investing

Subject files created during DeGiovanni's role as Senior Advisor to the President document the Ford Foundation's strategy development for its Thematic Areas and Regional Offices between 2015 and 2016.

Common material formats found throughout the collection include correspondence, memos, notes, drafts, reports, proposals, articles, meeting materials, and presentation materials. There are also a few photographs and some digital media.

did.unittitle: Frank DeGiovanni notebooks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains notebooks Frank DeGiovanni created and used throughout most of his career at the Ford Foundation. There are a set of notebooks that were dated and a set of notebooks that were numbered. The dated set was arranged chronologically during processing, and the numbered set was ordered numerically and placed after the dated notebooks in the series.
DeGiovanni used the notebooks for meetings, "to dos", program strategy, and other activities.
Other documents were inserted into the notebooks like other notes, correspondence, meeting materials, and business cards.

Subject files

physdesc.extent: 67.5 document boxes: 53.5 letter boxes and 14 legal boxes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the subject files Frank DeGiovanni created and maintained throughout his various positions at the Ford Foundation. There are two main groups of files that are intermixed throughout the series. One group documents DeGiovanni's leadership of the Foundation's asset building and economic development programming, and the other documents his work as Senior Advisor to the Foundation's President. There are also a few records that originate from the time DeGiovanni worked in the Foundation's Program Related Investments (PRI) as a Program Officer and then Deputy Director.

DeGiovanni created the files pertaining to the Foundation's asset building and economic development programming when he served as Director of the Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS) Economic Development unit and then Director of the Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) Financial Assets unit. These records document the Foundation's engagement with financial asset building and poverty reduction for lower income families, increasing access to financial services, promoting savings and children's savings accounts, development finance, pro-poor development, microfinance, sustainable development, value chains, food security, consumer protection, housing, and impact investment.

Expanding Livelihood Opportunities for Poor Households Initiative (ELOPHI), Building Economic Security Over a Lifetime (BESOL), Improving Access to Financial Services, and Saving for Education, Entrepreneurship, and Downpayment (SEED) were major initiatives of the programs DeGiovanni led. Many files document the Foundation's partnerships with organizations like the Consultative Group to Assist the Poor (CGAP), Self-Help Ventures Fund, and the University of North Carolina Center for Community Capital (CCC).

The files also show DeGiovanni's broader activities as a director of these units. There are materials regarding meetings, trips, administration, program strategy, and budget. His management of Program Officers is documented within Program Officer Memos and specific meeting files.
The files DeGiovanni created as Senior Advisor to the President regard the Ford Foundation's larger strategy development through its Thematic Areas and Regional Offices between 2015 and 2016.
